result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Clinton Bradley
Current: W360 N5103 Brown Street, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 2301 Aviation Drive, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

10:38 AM Defendant Clinton Bradley in court.  Attorney Jessica Klein on behalf of Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Clinton Bradley.  Attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is still in the process of receiving and reviewing discovery.
Atty Gordon advises the court that there is a trial pending in Washington county arising from the same event. Parties would like to see the conclusion of that before resolving this case.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:19 AM Defendant Clinton Bradley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

COURT ORDERED A $5,000.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $25,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.

COURT ORDERED A $5,000.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $25,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. 01:10 PM Defendant Clinton Bradley in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
